intro: Krainzia decipiens subsp. camptotricha, commonly known as the mountain krainzia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It is a perennial herb characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
